Coverage remained the same at 81.237% when pulling **f64436fe687aa5a35410b9b2051c66b5f827395b on mistercrunch:fix_separator** into **e243a14c64c97f81e205037bb11bcd9170c17163 on airbnb:master**.
Which version? How are you serving static files?

解决：
1、 vi caravel/assets/package.json 

"jquery-ui": "^1.10.5",  ->  "jquery-ui": "1.10.5",

2、To install third party libraries defined in package.json, run the following within the caravel/assets/ directory which will install them in a new node_modules/ folder within assets/.

npm install

3、To parse and generate bundled files for caravel, run either of the following commands. The dev flag will keep the npm script running and re-run it upon any changes within the assets directory.

npm run prod

done!!!!  :)

stpes to reproduce,
1. install caravel, create admin
2. init db, load samples
3. create sample local user, add him to gamma role.
4. assign list/add/delete/edit privileges to gamma role over DashboardModelview, DashboardModelviewSync
5. login with sample user
6. create dashboard 
7. list dashboards (list do not show any dashboard)
This is happening only in case of ldap user. So to correct step 3, login with ldap user with gamma role assigned.

I have a [windows-support](https://github.com/aljones/caravel/tree/windows-support) branch. It uses [waitress](http://docs.pylonsproject.org/projects/waitress/en/latest/) which I have no prior experience with. There are also changes in that branch to support mssql better. Been testing it this week with a couple users. Would be nice to hear if it works for others.
@PickLiDan It's already fixed in master.

@aljones nice! 7ee6cc5a7203cfe06104ba38e0e96ced876e0897,  377c8268071137e7f69827c85b892e9073e747f2 and 1433e73087d23598b1e55080eb16f8572a121a9c looks sensible if you can put in a branch on their own and open a PR would be great. Same for 01756af399a5f4ec6ef8e64c283227dea60e7dc9 and another branch for 07443fd9bf161d6d64c08eee672dca0d4b587598
Please add this feature!

Also the same issue with a completely different dataset that was working yesterday. Today it suddenly isn't recognized with any tables.

I've followed the tutorial about 5 times on different VMs and static machines, nothing. I've changed permissions and the user too but it doesn't change anything. 

I can link to my dataset if someone would like to try and tell me what they did differently.

https://www.sendspace.com/file/c0rx4l - db file
https://www.sendspace.com/file/c0rx4l - csv version so you can innately see the tables and what should be working. 

The weird part is that this is what it looks like on the SQL query page: http://i.imgur.com/no3b47y.png

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/7427492/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/7427492)

Coverage remained the same at 81.237% when pulling **9150919551d80c1fad9807ea72f9611b6045d80f on mistercrunch:warning_msg** into **e243a14c64c97f81e205037bb11bcd9170c17163 on airbnb:master**.

@xrmx It's a glitch. It'll recognize the wrong data field (even though I clearly have one labeled "Country") and then the user cannot do anything.

Like the specific indication for temporal data dimensions, there should be one specifically for global data or "spatial". People can add this themselves, sure, but it's disingenuous to say that it's not a hindrance/glitch the way it is now.

LGTM
just a minor comment about the config var name.
I think I'll stick with `WARNING_MSG` as I'd have to change on the chef (in like 5-10 places total) side as well and the boxes are going through their first converge now.
@xrmx I realized it, thank you :)

You don't have the bin dir inside ./local in your path. Said that (as every other python project) we recommend to create a virtualenv and install caravel in it. See  https://github.com/airbnb/caravel/blob/master/docs/installation.rst#python-virtualenv
@robbinhan which version of caravel is that? ~~have you upgraded without running _npm install_ again?~~  thanks for reporting!

This is an amazing feature! I'm really excited about how it will integrate with "SQL Lab", a sql IDE I'm working on for Caravel. Those familiar with Airflow (my other big open source project), know how it's baked in Airflow pretty deeply.

I had thought of adding support for Jinja macros but was thinking they would live in the Caravel codebase, but I like the idea of putting them in the database as well. Of course it's a security concern but we just have to limit editing/adding macros to the admin role.

Let's render the custom where and having clause as well!
https://github.com/airbnb/caravel/blob/master/caravel/models.py#L730-L733

This is very cool. Now I'm thinking of ways to also allow people to add macro modules in their environment (through their `caravel_config.py`), and expose a quick-reference modal in the UI to browse macros/functions, but that's out of scope of this PR.
I just pushed a fixed to `package.json`, should be good now.

Which file is this from? Can you paste a link to its path here? 
Thanks!
@mistercrunch bootstrap-toogle is still missing though?

I think there should be an approach to stop rendering. For example if I choose the wrong parameters and I want to stop it and re-render the data. This seems to be an common operation in my caravel app.

@DylanAlloy I got the same problem.

This is what I got. The only thing different is I set the database uri to my posgres database. 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5859702/17650388/07fadc2a-627f-11e6-94df-5f958040afb2.png)

And I can't edit tables. And when I click edit button of a table I got this:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5859702/17650399/3f2996e6-627f-11e6-950f-fd9bc9aa9640.png)

The most weird thing is when I click SQL editor. It works:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5859702/17650406/a371d3d4-627f-11e6-8c27-8005febec2fb.png)

It is really weird that I can't edit the table.
Guys, please calm down. No need to post random screenshots or saying "nothing works". What would be helpful was to state your caravel version and post any eventual backtrace you've found in the logs.

Yeah I don't understand that. I can't contribute much more, I spent 48 hours for a work project trying to figure it out and I'm useless. Eventually I just tried a different dataset.

The thing that's weird is that it obviously reads from the tables and it works sometimes. Other times it just doesn't suddenly.

> Guys, please calm down. 
> 
> random screenshots

Lol, okay I'm going to dip out of this repo now but good luck. I was using the most recent version as of this comment and regretfully I don't have access to the logs, I was using Vagrant and the VMs have since been destroyed.

@seanDot7 Agreed. I'm going to work on this as it really gets in the way of some cool viz. I also will work on adding better color coding to the world map. You'll notice countries with "very little data" are white (which makes them blend in with the background) and countries with no data at all are grey, making them visible when they are not represented. 

I'll add these features and probably fork it within the month.
Make sure you dont use cache, like Redis. I saw it still not works well.
After rm total node_modules and reinstall . It is fine.
what kind of datasource is that?

@mistercrunch Thanks for all you comments. And I'm really glad to see that you like the idea as well. Originally, I thought of putting macros in template files too, but then we need do a deployment and restart caravel server on every macro updates. And in my company, DevOps are responsible for all the server deployment, but they're not caravel users (data scientists/analyst are end users). I think that's pretty common, other companies might have similar setup as well. So I think having them in DB would be more friendly to end users. 

For your last comment, you mentioned adding macro modules in their `caravel_config.py`. Do you mean allowing users to write Python functions (instead of jinja macros) and have them available when constructing SQL expressions? I think that's cool, but if we do this, we do need take more consideration on security, because python functions could be very powerful but also more dangerous than jinja macros.
@rlanda take a look at druid support if you want an example on how this could be done
Closing then, thanks @jiamo for the update
Most recent commit from the master branch. Statics files are served after unpacking using `npm run prod`
@rhp4515 have you tried `rm -rf node_modules && npm install` again?

@aljones looks good to me, next time please add Fix #915 to your commit so the bug is closed automatically. Also any chance you can update the docs too? https://github.com/airbnb/caravel/blob/master/docs/installation.rst#configuration Thanks!

@aljones ENATIME_ROTATE_LOG_LEVEL override LOG_LEVEL if ENABLE_TIME_ROTATE is set. So supposedly the idea is being able to switch ENABLE_TIME_ROTATE without updating LOG_LEVEL everytime. But switching on and off rotating logs does not looks like something sane to do :) Anyway unless this bothers you that much just leave as it is to avoid breaking people config :)
It could be a network issue on your side, a network issue on npm side or whatever in between. Anyway we can't do much about that, sorry :)
@jalonsob what does your browser's js console say? Do you have MAPBOX_API_KEY set in your config?
PR for this feature is here: https://github.com/airbnb/caravel/pull/814

My browser's js console says:

Error: An API access token is required to use Mapbox GL

You are right I need MAPBOX_API_KEY in my configuration. How can I get it?
@jalonsob i suppose you just need to create an account on mapbox :)

@birdspring @mahedi0244 . I have the same problem.  I got the error : "Please define at least one metric for your table". I have tried posgres and mysql, both have the same error. However when I used sqlite3 as caravel database it works well. I don't know which step I made mistake at. Would you please elaborate your steps in configuring mysql as the backend database?

After checking this further, I switched back to sqlite backend and enabled successfully Redis cache. For now I don't see real need to use MySQL as backend. Here is my caravel config file:

ROW_LIMIT = 50000
CARAVEL_WORKERS = 16
CARAVEL_WEBSERVER_ADDRESS = '0.0.0.0'
CARAVEL_WEBSERVER_PORT = 8088
CARAVEL_WEBSERVER_TIMEOUT = 60
CUSTOM_SECURITY_MANAGER = None
SECRET_KEY = '\2\1changethis\1\2\e\y\y\h'
SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI = 'sqlite:////opt/caravel/caravel.db'
LOG_LEVEL = 'INFO'
CACHE_DEFAULT_TIMEOUT = 30
CACHE_CONFIG = {
    'CACHE_TYPE': 'redis',
    'CACHE_DEFAULT_TIMEOUT': 30,
    'CACHE_KEY_PREFIX': 'caravel_',
    'CACHE_REDIS_HOST': 'localhost',
    'CACHE_REDIS_PORT': 6379,
    'CACHE_REDIS_DB': 1,
    'CACHE_REDIS_URL': 'redis://localhost:6379/1'
   }
Thank you very much.
Thanks.  I was just surprised that when I changed it that it also changed the console output, but it is no problem.
Yeah, I'll change the docs.
Given I've no mssql knowledge LGTM :)

ur comment solved my issue can u put that link instead of http://airbnb.io/caravel/installation.html that is in the readme  file both got the same content anyway except virtualenv part as far as I can tell  so it can help others .
It looks like it's a silver bullet, see https://github.com/mapbox/mapbox-gl-js/issues/1649#issuecomment-153500333

Yes though Presto provides a much better experience than Hive itself. Refer to pyhive's docs for URL format.
It's not perfect, but the `Bottom Margin` parameter allows users to give more room for the axis.

A few notes from our conversation:
- Let's use javascript objects (not json) over yaml
- We want to support both UI forms and source control!
- The UI could pivot to JSON
- We may need a "policy" where an admin would be able to define which datasources are editable in UI vs source control
  *...
Commit cite Postgresql but you are not doing anything specific for it.

I am using Caravel 0.10.0 and the database in the caravel_config.py is:

SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI = 'sqlite:///.../caravel.db'
Closing then, feel free to reopen if doesn't work in the next release.
Preparing an `airbnb_prod` realease, so I'm merging this in now
Postgres was working with the current default setup. Though I might want to run the `caravel db upgrade` twice as part of the test to prevent a regression.

To me this looks unneeded as hive has timestamps field that should supports our default dttm format:
https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/Hive/LanguageManual+Types#LanguageManualTypes-Timestamps
@xrmx good catch, I made the options translatable
About macro modules in `caravel_config`, that would be done by admins for exposing system-wide macros, not just by any user.

fixed!

subjet: # **column_name  ---> upper(column_name)   cause exceptions** 

1.# **test.py**

#!/usr/bin/python
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

d={}
d['a']=['1','2']
d['b']=['3','4']
d['c']=['2','2']

df = pd.DataFrame(d)

print('--------- 1 ----------')
print(df.pivot_table( values='c', index=['a'],columns=['b'], aggfunc=np.sum,margins=True))

print('--------- 2 ----------')
print(pd.pivot_table(df, values='c', index=['a'],columns=['b'], aggfunc=np.sum,margins=True))

print('--------- 3 ----------')
print(df.pivot_table( values='c', index=['a'],columns=['B'], aggfunc=np.sum,margins=True))

print('--------- 4 ----------')
print(pd.pivot_table(df, values='c', index=['a'],columns=['B'], aggfunc=np.sum,margins=True)) 
1. **# change column_name 'b'  to 'B'   then  run test.py** 

--------- 1 ----------
b       3     4 All
a  
1       2  None   2
2    None     2   2
All     2     2  22
--------- 2 ----------
b       3     4 All
a  
1       2  None   2
2    None     2   2
All     2     2  22
--------- 3 ----------
